revised_title: Vibration Spectra of Hydrocarbon Molecules: Skeletal Frequencies in Branched Paraffins
tldr: The authors studied the vibration spectra of hydrocarbon molecules, specifically branched paraffins, and found that certain frequencies are characteristic of the carbon skeleton of these molecules. They used a simple valency force field model to calculate frequencies and found satisfactory agreement with observed frequencies. This research helps in understanding the complex absorption spectra of paraffins, which was mainly attributed to hydrogen atom vibrations.
